peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are Bulova watches worth anything?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Bulova watches cost around $200 on average, though prices range from around $23 to $1,000 depending on the model. Bulova's most popular collection, the Classic, costs an average of $100. Other popular collections include the Marine Star, Precisionist, and Crystal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Bulova Prices as of March 2025 - WatchCharts

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I tell how old my Bulova watch is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Locate the date code. These symbols are typically located on the inside movement of the watch, so you or a professional jeweler will need to open the watch to locate the code. Bulova watches made between 1950 and 2009 are marked with a two-digit alpha-numeric date code.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Date a Bulova Watch: 11 Steps (with Pictures) - wikiHow

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Will a pawn shop buy a Bulova watch?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: However, it's important to note that not all watches need to be from high-end brands to be eligible for pawning. Some mid-range brands like Seiko, Citizen, or Bulova may still hold value and can be accepted by pawnbrokers.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Factors that Affect A Watch's Value in Pawn Shops - Times Ticking
